body_html:
I suspect there is a file descriptors leak. I'm using PyTorch 0.4.0 and I get that error when doing inference (no troubles on training). Particular the error happens when I'm using TTA, so much more samples are being processed.

First time I got the error I increased file descriptors limit to 10000, but even with that number at some point it crashed. Finally it worked using 40000 as limit. But anyway, I was monitoring the number of open file descriptors over time and it was always increasing.

The command I used to monitor them where:

sudo find -maxdepth 1 -type d -name '[0-9]*'      -exec bash -c "ls {}/fd/ | wc -l | tr '\n' ' '" \;      -printf "fds (PID = %P), command: "      -exec bash -c "tr '\0' ' ' < {}/cmdline" \;      -exec echo \; | sort -rn | head

executed on /proc folder

The process that generates the problem is the root one. The workers don't show that many open files.

I also got a capture of lsof on the root process. The file is quite big, so I just paste here some parts of the file:

[some typical entries]
...
python  27103 ivan  DEL    REG               0,25              3543 /dev/shm/torch_27123_166186690
python  27103 ivan  DEL    REG               0,25              3528 /dev/shm/torch_27123_2212114676

body_text:
I suspect there is a file descriptors leak. I'm using PyTorch 0.4.0 and I get that error when doing inference (no troubles on training). Particular the error happens when I'm using TTA, so much more samples are being processed.
First time I got the error I increased file descriptors limit to 10000, but even with that number at some point it crashed. Finally it worked using 40000 as limit. But anyway, I was monitoring the number of open file descriptors over time and it was always increasing.
The command I used to monitor them where:
sudo find -maxdepth 1 -type d -name '[0-9]*'      -exec bash -c "ls {}/fd/ | wc -l | tr '\n' ' '" \;      -printf "fds (PID = %P), command: "      -exec bash -c "tr '\0' ' ' < {}/cmdline" \;      -exec echo \; | sort -rn | head

executed on /proc folder
The process that generates the problem is the root one. The workers don't show that many open files.
I also got a capture of lsof on the root process. The file is quite big, so I just paste here some parts of the file:

body:
I suspect there is a file descriptors leak. I'm using PyTorch 0.4.0 and I get that error when doing inference (no troubles on training). Particular the error happens when I'm using TTA, so much more samples are being processed. 

First time I got the error I increased file descriptors limit to 10000, but even with that number at some point it crashed. Finally it worked using 40000 as limit. But anyway, I was monitoring the number of open file descriptors over time and it was always increasing. 

The command I used to monitor them where:

```
sudo find -maxdepth 1 -type d -name '[0-9]*'      -exec bash -c "ls {}/fd/ | wc -l | tr '\n' ' '" \;      -printf "fds (PID = %P), command: "      -exec bash -c "tr '\0' ' ' < {}/cmdline" \;      -exec echo \; | sort -rn | head
```
executed on `/proc` folder

The process that generates the problem is the root one. The workers don't show that many open files. 

I also got a capture of `lsof` on the root process. The file is quite big, so I just paste here some parts of the file:
